member.name: T:OTAPI.Core.IEntity
member.summary: IEntity is designed to be the base of all entities in the application. Said examples of these entities may be: Command line sender TerrariaEntity (which is Projectiles, Players, Npcs etc) External assembly's implementation defined in an external assembly.

member.name: T:OTAPI.Core.TerrariaEntity
member.summary: TerrariaEntity is intended to be the inclusive base of all vanilla terraria entities, so will be used instead of the patcher injecting IEntity.
member.remarks: Developers: We must ensure we don't introduce new requirements that conflict with: Terraria.Player Terraria.NPC Terraria.Projectile

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Item.NetDefaultsBegin(Terraria.Item,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the start of the NetDefaults method. The return value will dictate if normal vanilla code should continue to run.
member.returns: True to continue on to vanilla code, otherwise false

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Item.NetDefaultsEnd(Terraria.Item,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the end of the NetDefaults method.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Item.SetDefaultsByNameBegin(Terraria.Item,System.String@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the start of the SetDefaults(string) method. The return value will dictate if normal vanilla code should continue to run.
member.returns: True to continue on to vanilla code, otherwise false

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Item.SetDefaultsByNameEnd(Terraria.Item,System.String@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the end of the SetDefaults(string) method.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Item.SetDefaultsByIdBegin(Terraria.Item,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the start of the SetDefaults(int,bool) method. The return value will dictate if normal vanilla code should continue to run.
member.returns: True to continue on to vanilla code, otherwise false

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Item.SetDefaultsByIdEnd(Terraria.Item,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the end of the SetDefaults(int,bool) method.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Main.startDedInput
member.summary: This method is injected into the start of the startDedInput method. The return value will dictate if normal vanilla code should continue to run.
member.returns: True to continue on to vanilla code, otherwise false

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Main.InitializeBegin
member.summary: This method is injected to the beginning of the terraria Initialize method.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Main.InitializeEnd
member.summary: This method is injected into the end of the terraria Initialize method.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Main.UpdateBegin(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime@)
member.summary: This method is injected to the beginning of the terraria Update method.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Main.UpdateEnd(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the end of the terraria Update method.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.MessageBuffer.NameCollision(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: This method is injected on the if block that surrounds the player name collision kick.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.NetMessage.GreetPlayerBegin(System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method is called immediately before any code of the greetPlayer method executes.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.NetMessage.GreetPlayerEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called after the vanilla greetPlayer method finishes.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.NetMessage.SendBytes(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,Terraria.Net.Sockets.SocketSendCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method replaces most calls to AsyncSend in the SendData method

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Npc.Create(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the StrikeNPC method along with an additional variable [cancelResult] which is returned if this method returns false.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Npc.NetDefaultsBegin(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the start of the NetDefaults method. The return value will dictate if normal vanilla code should continue to run.
member.returns: True to continue on to vanilla code, otherwise false

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Npc.NetDefaultsEnd(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the end of the NetDefaults method.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Npc.SetDefaultsByNameBegin(Terraria.NPC,System.String@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the start of the SetDefaults(string) method. The return value will dictate if normal vanilla code should continue to run.
member.returns: True to continue on to vanilla code, otherwise false

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Npc.SetDefaultsByNameEnd(Terraria.NPC,System.String@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the end of the SetDefaults(string) method.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Npc.SetDefaultsByIdBegin(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the start of the SetDefaults(int,float) method. The return value will dictate if normal vanilla code should continue to run.
member.returns: True to continue on to vanilla code, otherwise false

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Npc.SetDefaultsByIdEnd(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the end of the SetDefaults(int,float) method.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Callbacks.Terraria.Npc.Strike(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This method is injected into the StrikeNPC method along with an additional variable [cancelResult] which is returned if this method returns false.

member.name: M:OTAPI.Core.Debug.Assert.Expression(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Asserts the specified LINQ expression for a true condition and throws an assertion failure exception indicating the compiled expression which failed, if the result of the expression is true.
member.param: A LINQ-style expression which to evaluate
member.example:
Use a LINQ-style expression to evaluate an assertion expression.
Assert.Expression(() => objectRef.Property == null);
member.remarks: This code will only run in debug mode. Calls to this method are ignored when the DEBUG symbol is not defined.

member.name: T:OTAPI.Core.HookResult
member.summary: Defines a result from a hook to be actioned by OTAPI

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.HookResult.Continue
member.summary: Typically used to continue on to vanilla code

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.HookResult.Cancel
member.summary: Typically used to stop executing vanilla code

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Command.StartCommandThread
member.summary: Occurs when the server is to start listening for commands.

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Game.PreInitialize
member.summary: Occurs at the first point of call when the Initialze method is ran.

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Game.PostInitialize
member.summary: Occurs at the end of the games initialize method.

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Game.PreUpdate
member.summary: Occurs at the first point of call when the game is running the update loop.

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Game.PostUpdate
member.summary: Occurs at the end of the games update loop.

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Item.PreNetDefaults
member.summary: Occurs at the start of the NetDefaults(int) method. Arg 1: The item instance 2: Type

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Item.PostNetDefaults
member.summary: Occurs when the NetDefaults(int) method ends Arg 1: The item instance 2: Type

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Item.PreSetDefaultsByName
member.summary: Occurs at the start of the SetDefaults(string) method. Arg 1: The item instance 2: Item name

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Item.PostSetDefaultsByName
member.summary: Occurs when the SetDefaults(string) method ends Arg 1: The item instance 2: Item name

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Item.PreSetDefaultsById
member.summary: Occurs at the start of the SetDefaults(int,bool) method Arg 1: The item instance 2: Type 3: noMatCheck flag

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Item.PostSetDefaultsById
member.summary: Occurs when the SetDefaults(int,bool) method ends Arg 1: The item instance 2: Type 3: noMatCheck flag

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Net.PreGreetPlayer
member.summary: Occurs at the start of the greetPlayer method. Arg 1: playerid

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Net.PostGreetPlayer
member.summary: Occurs at the end of the greetPlayer method. Arg 1: playerid

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Net.NameCollision
member.summary: Occurs when a connecting player is about to be booted due to having the same name as a player whom is already playing. Arg 1: player instance

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Net.SendBytes
member.summary: Occurs when the server is about to send data to a client

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Npc.PreNetDefaults
member.summary: Occurs at the start of the NetDefaults(int) method. Arg 1: The npc instance 2: Type

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Npc.PostNetDefaults
member.summary: Occurs when the NetDefaults(int) method ends Arg 1: The npc instance 2: Type

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Npc.PreSetDefaultsByName
member.summary: Occurs at the start of the SetDefaults(string) method. Arg 1: The npc instance 2: Npc name

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Npc.PostSetDefaultsByName
member.summary: Occurs when the SetDefaults(string) method ends Arg 1: The npc instance 2: Npc name

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Npc.PreSetDefaultsById
member.summary: Occurs at the start of the SetDefaults(int,float) method. Arg 1: The npc instance 2: Type 3: noMatCheck flag

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Npc.PostSetDefaultsById
member.summary: Occurs when the SetDefaults(int,float) method ends Arg 1: The npc instance 2: Npc name

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Npc.Strike
member.summary: Occurs at the start of the NetDefaults(int) method. Arg 1: The npc instance 2: Value to be returned if the hook cancelled the event 3: damage 4: knock back 5: hit direction 6: Type 7: crit 8: no effect 9: from net

member.name: F:OTAPI.Core.Hooks.Npc.Transform
member.summary: Occurs when an npc transforms Arg 1: The npc instance=

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color
member.summary: Represents a four-component color using red, green, blue, and alpha data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color.R
member.summary: Gets or sets the red component value of this Color.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color.G
member.summary: Gets or sets the green component value of this Color.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color.B
member.summary: Gets or sets the blue component value of this Color.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color.A
member.summary: Gets or sets the alpha component value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color.PackedValue
member.summary: Gets the current color as a packed value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2.Dot(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the dot product of two vectors. If the two vectors are unit vectors, the dot product returns a floating point value between -1 and 1 that can be used to determine some properties of the angle between two vectors. For example, it can show whether the vectors are orthogonal, parallel, or have an acute or obtuse angle between them.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2.Dot(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates the dot product of two vectors and writes the result to a user-specified variable. If the two vectors are unit vectors, the dot product returns a floating point value between -1 and 1 that can be used to determine some properties of the angle between two vectors. For example, it can show whether the vectors are orthogonal, parallel, or have an acute or obtuse angle between them.
member.param: [OutAttribute] The dot product of the two vectors.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2.Normalize
member.summary: Turns the current vector into a unit vector. The result is a vector one unit in length pointing in the same direction as the original vector.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2.Normalize(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Creates a unit vector from the specified vector. The result is a vector one unit in length pointing in the same direction as the original vector.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2.Normalize(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@)
member.summary: Creates a unit vector from the specified vector, writing the result to a user-specified variable. The result is a vector one unit in length pointing in the same direction as the original vector.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2.Barycentric(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a Vector2 containing the 2D Cartesian coordinates of a point specified in barycentric (areal) coordinates relative to a 2D triangle.
member.param: A Vector2 containing the 2D Cartesian coordinates of vertex 1 of the triangle.
A Vector2 containing the 2D Cartesian coordinates of vertex 2 of the triangle.
A Vector2 containing the 2D Cartesian coordinates of vertex 3 of the triangle.
Barycentric coordinate b2, which expresses the weighting factor toward vertex 2 (specified in value2).
Barycentric coordinate b3, which expresses the weighting factor toward vertex 3 (specified in value3).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2.Barycentric(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,System.Single,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@)
member.summary: Returns a Vector2 containing the 2D Cartesian coordinates of a point specified in barycentric (areal) coordinates relative to a 2D triangle.
member.param: A Vector2 containing the 2D Cartesian coordinates of vertex 1 of the triangle.
A Vector2 containing the 2D Cartesian coordinates of vertex 2 of the triangle.
A Vector2 containing the 2D Cartesian coordinates of vertex 3 of the triangle.
Barycentric coordinate b2, which expresses the weighting factor toward vertex 2 (specified in value2).
Barycentric coordinate b3, which expresses the weighting factor toward vertex 3 (specified in value3).
[OutAttribute] The 2D Cartesian coordinates of the specified point are placed in this Vector2 on exit.
